title: Implement DiffableStr abstraction for generic text diffing
description:
# Implement DiffableStr Abstraction for Generic Text Diffing

## Problem Statement
Currently TextDiff only works with String tokens (Array(String)), but Rust's similar crate supports multiple string-like types via DiffableStr/DiffableStrRef traits. This prevents implementing features like:
- similar-b07: SliceRemapper utility tests (requires generic text diffing)
- similar-knq: Bytes support for binary diffing
- Full inline diff implementation (requires word-level diffing with proper tokenization)

The core limitation is Crystal's type system: arrays of abstract types are not directly supported, and generic constraints with duck typing require careful design.

## Solution Requirements
1. DiffableStr interface - Abstract module/class defining required methods:
   - size : Int - Length in characters/graphemes
   - [] indexing - Access by character position
   - slice - Extract substrings
   - to_s - Convert to String for display
   - Optional: bytesize, codepoints, etc.

2. Wrapper structs implementing DiffableStr:
   - StringWrapper - Wraps String (zero-cost abstraction)
   - BytesWrapper - Wraps Bytes for binary diffing
   - Future: RopeWrapper, GraphemeWrapper, etc.

3. Generic TextDiff - class TextDiff(T) where T includes DiffableStr
   - Works with Array(T) instead of Array(String)
   - Maintains backward compatibility via String specialization

4. Updated infrastructure:
   - capture_diff_slices in src/common.cr - Generic type support
   - Algorithms::Myers and Algorithms::Patience - Generic token arrays
   - TextDiffConfig - Generic constraints
   - iter_inline_changes - Word-level diffing with proper tokenization

## Implementation Options

### Option 1: Union Types (Simpler)
alias DiffableStr = String | Bytes
- Pros: Simple, no wrapper overhead
- Cons: Type checks at runtime, harder to extend, method dispatch complexity

### Option 2: Wrapper Structs (Recommended)
module DiffableStr
  abstract def size : Int32
  abstract def [](index : Int32) : Char
  abstract def slice(range : Range) : self
  abstract def to_s : String
end

struct StringWrapper
  include DiffableStr
  getter str : String
  # ... implementations
end
- Pros: Clean abstraction, extensible, matches Rust pattern
- Cons: More boilerplate, wrapper overhead (minimal)

### Option 3: Generic Constraints with Duck Typing
class TextDiff(T)
  # T must respond to .size, .[], .slice, .to_s
- Pros: No wrapper overhead, compile-time checking
- Cons: Crystal's duck typing limitations, harder to document

## Recommended Approach: Wrapper Structs
Matches Rust's architecture most closely and provides clear extensibility path.

## Files to Modify/Create

1. src/text/abstraction.cr (new) - DiffableStr module and wrapper structs
2. src/text/mod.cr - Make TextDiff generic: class TextDiff(T)
3. src/common.cr - Update capture_diff_slices for generic T
4. src/iter.cr - Make Diff::Iterator and OpCodeIterator generic
5. src/text/utils.cr - Update QuickSeqRatio for generic types
6. spec/text_spec.cr - Add tests with wrapper types
7. spec/bytes_spec.cr (future) - Bytes diffing tests

## Implementation Steps

1. Create DiffableStr abstraction in src/text/abstraction.cr
2. Implement StringWrapper struct (zero-cost via delegate)
3. Make TextDiff generic with backward compatibility alias:
   alias StringTextDiff = TextDiff(StringWrapper)
4. Update algorithms to work with Array(T) instead of Array(String)
5. Add conversion helpers:
   def self.diff_strings(old : String, new : String) : StringTextDiff
     TextDiff(StringWrapper).new([StringWrapper.new(old)], [StringWrapper.new(new)])
   end
6. Update existing tests to use wrapper API
7. Add comprehensive tests for generic functionality

## Dependencies & Blocking

- Blocks: similar-b07 (SliceRemapper), similar-knq (Bytes support)
- Required for: Full inline diff implementation (word-level tokenization)
- Part of epic: similar-j7m (Test Verification Phase)

## Testing Strategy

1. Backward compatibility: Existing tests must pass unchanged
2. Wrapper validation: Test StringWrapper behaves identically to String
3. Generic functionality: Test TextDiff with custom wrapper types
4. Performance: Ensure zero/minimal overhead for String case

## Success Criteria

- [ ] DiffableStr module with abstract methods
- [ ] StringWrapper struct implementing DiffableStr
- [ ] Generic TextDiff(T) class
- [ ] Backward compatibility via String specialization
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests for wrapper functionality
- [ ] Ready for BytesWrapper implementation (similar-knq)

## Risks & Mitigations

- Risk: Performance regression for String diffs
  - Mitigation: Use delegate macros, inline wrappers, benchmark comparisons
- Risk: Complex type signatures throughout codebase
  - Mitigation: Provide type aliases (StringTextDiff), keep public API simple
- Risk: Breaking changes to public API
  - Mitigation: Maintain backward compatibility with deprecated methods

## References

- Rust source: src/traits.rs (DiffableStr, DiffableStrRef)
- Rust source: src/text/ (generic text diffing implementation)
- Current Crystal: src/text/mod.cr (String-only TextDiff)
- Issue dependencies: similar-b07, similar-knq
